result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Restitution filed in Case #2013CF000452 pursuant to agreement. Restitution ordered in and paid to the victim in that case.

10:48 am
 Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost. Prosecuting Attorney Haley J. Rea for the State appears. Victim Lawrence Yopp in court. Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi appears in court with Trevor Kula. 
Atty Frost states there is an agreement. Her client will accept the agreement of $5000. 
Atty Nepomiachi states that is the agreement of her client as well.
Agreement by Atty Rea. 
Court orders Atty Frost to prepare the order.
Court adjourned.
10:52 am
ak

Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 10:37 a.m. - Appearances made. There is no agreement in these matters. Statement by attorney Melissa Frost regarding new information and additional claims that they have just received. Attorney Frost indicates also that she has been trying to locate photographs of the trailers, but has not yet received them. Court finds that based on this new information a new date will need to be set and continues hearing. Matter is continued. State provides the Court with packet of information provided to the attorneys.
Court orders that the State file an amended restitution request form with amended amounts for next hearing.
Court in recess @ 10:45 a.m.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Further proceedings on December 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
BOND QUASHED ON THIS FILE ONLY.

Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case dismissed and read-in.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 22, 2021 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Joshua P Grube appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved.

Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

BOND TOTAL BOTH FILES: 2014CF000028 AND 2013CF000452. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH P.R.M. (DOB 5/16/98). NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM, L.Y.. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR TREVOR KULA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Daniel A Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Matter set for waiver of preliminary hearing.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 6, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
